maml:description.maml:para: Modify selected hostnames for a security policy.

Append one or more hostnames to a configuration's selected hostnames. Request body must be in the format returned by Get-AppSecSelectedHostnames, e.g. @{hostnameList = @(@{hostname = 'www.example.com'})}. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
A unique identifier for a security policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
List available hostnames for a new configuration.

Lists the hostnames for a given contract and group. Use this operation for a new configuration, and use Get-AppSecSelectableHostnames to see a list of hostnames you can add to an existing configuration. This operation shows you every acceptable hostname you can use, where the other hostname operation omits any hostnames already included in your configuration.
A unique identifier for a group.
A unique identifier for a contract.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Get configuration version details.

List all versions of a configuration, or specify an indibvidual with VersionNumber. To get a more extensive object with detailed information about a version's security policies, rate policies, rules, and other additional settings, run the Export-AppSecConfiguration operation. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
When true, the results contain detailed information on versions. With the default false, the results contain summary information on versions.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
The index of the result page. If the value is -1, then pagination is ignored. The default value is 1.
The number of items on each result page. The default value is 25.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

List discovered API endpoints.

Returns API endpoints for the specified hostname and base path. Unlike Get-AppSecDiscoveredAPI , this command returns APIs already in your API definitions. When you see a discovered API or a new resource, add it to your definition with New-AppSecDiscoveredAPIEndpoint.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
List evaluation hostnames.

List the evaluation hostnames for a configuration version. Run hostnames in evaluation mode to see how your configuration settings protect traffic for that hostname before adding a hostname directly to a live configuration. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Products: Web Application Protector, App & API Protector (without Advanced Security Module) (without Advanced Security Module).
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Get the evasive path match settings for a configuration.

Lists the evasive path match setting for a configuration. Evasive path match is off by default. This setting applies at the configuration level and applies to all policies within a configuration. If you want to view this setting for a specific policy, run Get-AppSecPolicyEvasivePathMatch. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Product: Web Application Protector, Kona Site Defender.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

The name of the security configuration.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Get the HTTP header log settings for a configuration.

Lists HTTP header logging controls for a configuration. HTTP header logging is on by default, and in most cases you should leave it enabled. You can filter requests by header type, including or excluding requests with a specific header, or by cookie. This operation applies at the configuration level, and therefore applies to all policies within a configuration. If you want to view these settings for a specific policy, run Get-AppSecPolicyLogging. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Get the penalty box for a policy in evaluation mode.

Returns the penalty box settings for a security policy in evaluation mode. When the penalty box is enabled for a policy, clients that trigger a Web Application Firewall deny action are placed in the penalty box. There, the action you select for penalty box (either `alert` or `deny`) continues to apply to any requests from that client for the next 10 minutes. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Get HTTP header log settings.

List a security policy's settings for HTTP header logging. HTTP header logging is on by default, and in most cases you should leave it enabled. You can filter requests by header type, including or excluding requests with a specific header, or by cookie. This operation applies at the security policy level, and overrides the HTTP header log settings at the configuration level on a per-policy basis. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.

Modify an API's visibility.

Hide an API. You can choose to include or exclude APIs from the response. This operation is per-user. If you hide an API from the response, another of your colleagues will still see that API in the response when they run this operation with their own credentials.
The base64-encoded value of the hostname.
The base64-encoded value of the base path.

The reason you've decided to hide the API from the API list. Use `NOT_ELIGIBLE` if you want to hide it for now and choose what to do with the API at a later time. Use `FALSE_POSITIVE` for APIs you feel are incorrectly included in the data.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Activate a configuration version.

Activates one or more configurations globally. Note that you need to explicitly list any invalid hosts in the AcknowledgedInvalidHosts parameter in order to successfully activate a configuration that includes invalid hostnames. You can choose to provide activation parameters, such as Network, individually, but by doing so the command can only activate a single configuration. If you wish to activate multiple configurations at once you must use the Body parameter and provide the request body as a string or PSCustomObject. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
The name of the security configuration.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

The list of invalid hostnames in the security configuration to activate. In some cases, you may want to activate a security configuration with hostnames that WAF can't protect (for example, hostnames not managed as Akamai properties, or managed under a different contract than the configuration)
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
The target Akamai activation environment, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`.
The notes you entered for the activation.
The email addresses to notify when the activation happens.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID. Note: this function takes as its input a list of Network List IDs ONLY, whereas Get-AppSecBypassNetworkLists returns multiple attributes. Make sure to limit the input to this function to only the IDs, either as an array or comma-separated string. Products: Web Application Protector, App & API Protector (without Advanced Security Module).
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Contains a list of networkList Ids.
A unique identifier for a security policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Set evaluation mode.

Evaluation mode runs concurrently with your existing Web Application Firewall Rule settings and records how the rules would respond if they were applied to live traffic. The default action for evaluation rules is `alert`. Use `START` to begin evaluation mode. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Set `eval` to `start`, `stop`, `restart`, `complete`, or `update` to manage the evaluation of new rules you want to test before you upgrade. If you set `eval` to `start`, `restart`, or `update`, the response object will have an `eval` value of `enabled`. The value is `disabled` for requests of `stop` or `complete`. For more information see Set evaluation mode (ref:post-policy-eval).

The type of update you want to make to the evaluation hostname list. You can `append` additional hostnames, `remove` hostnames from the list, or `replace` the existing list with the hostnames you pass in your request.
A unique identifier for a security policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Modify the evaluation penalty box.

Update the penalty box settings for a security policy in evaluation mode. If set to `true`, you can choose to `deny` requests coming from a client in the penalty box, or trigger an `alert` instead. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.

A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Specifies whether penalty box protection is enabled for the security policy. When set to `true` the `action` occurs if triggered by a request.

Modify the conditions and exceptions for an evaluation rule.

Update an evaluation rule's conditions and exceptions. When the conditions are met, the rule's actions are ignored and not applied to that specific traffic. The rule action you update with this operation is for a rule you are evaluating and not a rule currently in use for your site or app. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID. Products: Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module.

Modify the mode.

The mode you set determines how your rule sets are updated. If your configuration is still using Kona Rule Set, use `KRS` mode to update the rule sets manually, or `AAG` to have them update automatically. {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Modify the penalty box.

Modifies the penalty box settings for a security policy. When the penalty box is enabled for a policy, clients that trigger a WAF Deny action are placed in the penalty box . There, the action you select for penalty box (either `Alert` or `Deny`) continues to apply to any requests from that client for the next 10 minutes. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.
The name of the security configuration.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Specifies whether penalty box protection is enabled for the security policy. When set to `true` the `action` occurs if triggered by a request.
A unique identifier for a security policy.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Modify Pragma settings for a security policy.

Update the pragma header excluded conditions. By default, the `Pragma` header debugging information is stripped from an operation's response except in cases where you set `excludeCondition`. To remove existing settings, submit your request with an empty payload `{}`. To modify `Pragma` header settings at the security configuration level, run Set-AppSecPragmaSettings. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

The IPv4 action to assign to this rate policy. For `WAF` policies, choose `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Or use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action to your WAF rate policy. If the action is `none`, the rate policy is inactive in the policy.

The IPv6 action to assign to this rate policy. For `WAF` policies, choose `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Or use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action to your WAF rate policy. Run Modify a custom deny action (ref:put-custom-deny)to manage your custom deny actions. If the action is `none`, the rate policy is inactive in the policy.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Update the reputation analysis settings.

Toggle the `forwardToHTTPHeader` and `forwardSharedIPToHTTPHeaderAndSIEM` options. The `forwardToHTTPHeader` option adds client reputation details to requests forwarded to origin in an HTTP header. The `forwardSharedIPToHTTPHeaderAndSIEM` option adds a value indicating that shared IPs are included in HTTP header and SIEM integration when used. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID. Products: Kona Site Defender.

Update SIEM settings for a specific configuration. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The name of the security configuration.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Modify a URL protection policy.

Updates the specified URL protection policy. Due to the complexity of the request body it is recommended you retrieve the existing settings with Get-AppSecURLProtectionPolicy, edit locally, and pipe the object to this command. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'. Policy can be specified by PolicyName or PolicyID.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
A unique identifier for each URL protection policy.

{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Modify an API's visibility.

Hide or show an API. You can choose to include or exclude APIs from the response. This operation is per-user. If you hide an API from the response, another of your colleagues will still see that API in the response when they run this operation with their own credentials.
The base64-encoded value of the hostname.
The base64-encoded value of the base path.

The reason you've decided to hide the API from the API list. Use `NOT_ELIGIBLE` if you want to hide it for now and choose what to do with the API at a later time. Use `FALSE_POSITIVE` for APIs you feel are incorrectly included in the data.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
The base64-encoded value of the base path.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
The base64-encoded value of the hostname.

The reason you've decided to hide the API from the API list. Use `NOT_ELIGIBLE` if you want to hide it for now and choose what to do with the API at a later time. Use `FALSE_POSITIVE` for APIs you feel are incorrectly included in the data.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Upgrade KRS ruleset.

Upgrade to the most recent version of the KRS rule set. Akamai periodically updates these rules to keep protections current. However, the rules you use in your security policies do not automatically upgrade to the latest version when setting mode to KRS. These rules do update automatically when you have mode set to AAG. Configuration can be specified with ConfigName or ConfigID, and VersionNumber can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
A unique identifier for each version of a configuration. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for each configuration.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

The type of update you want to make to the evaluation hostname list. You can `append` additional hostnames, `remove` hostnames from the list, or `replace` the existing list with the hostnames you pass in your request.
A unique identifier for a security policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
